attributes.action: act on public opinion via epetitions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
after i have seen many e petitions come and go with many signatories, i urge the prime ministers office to take note of the opinions expressed and integrate this into policy, rather than just re-issuing old press statements via email that re-iterate current policy and say NO! We can all see what policy is on most public subjects, the purpose of creating and signing these petitions is to show that WE WANT CHANGE!
the government must realise that they work on behalf of the people and must act accordingly.
technology is now at a point where mass referendums via internet is becoming a real option, and if public opinion is not taken notice of now, soon e-referendums will make government redundant.

rejection.details: You should send comments on the e-petitions system to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
